paper.title: Key information systems issues for the 1980's

author.org: IBM Corporation, White Plains, New York#TAB#

paper.publisher: Society for Information Management and The Management Information Systems Research Center
paper.abstract: Knowledge of the most important issues in the information systems field would help focus research and educational efforts. A Delphi study, using leading information systems (IS) professionals, was used to identify and rank ten key IS management issues for the 1980u0027s. Measures were also taken to the amount of agreement achieved on these issues and rankings. The number one issue identified was improved IS planning, followed by facilitation and management of end user computing. This article describes the research approach involved and discusses the results.
